comments.text: Great spot to the north, all traffic comes pretty slow.
Good Spot, got a Ride to Ivalo relatively fast. Sign higly recommended.
Best spot to head north from Rovaniemi. Bus #8 comes here from the city and train station. Got a ride to Ivalo after 15min wait.
Extremely high traffic, lot of cars drive slowly to the north. Lot of space for car to stop on nearest bus stop.
Really bad luck here (3h) but two other groups came and went while I was waiting. They waited ~45m each.
Great spot, stood with sign and got a direct ride pretty quick.
Best place to hitchhike Jyvaskyla direction. Winter snow day waited for less than half hour got direct ride
Hitchiked to Jyväskylä on a friday afternoon and it took me less than 5 minutes to catch a ride.

I would suggest it also as a first spot, take the bus 28 from Keskustori, get off at bus stop Vastarannankatu, and walk about 2 km, because it is very worthy, I got a ride from a russian truck straight to Jyväskylä and farther to Pieksämäki in only a few minutes!
First time hitchhiking. Got ride in about 20 minutes.
Bus stop after the roundabout. Best spot to head south. Also possible to take a bus from the city close to here.
We got a ride straight to Helsinki in 15minutes at the bus stop.
Found a ride straight to Jyväskylä standing on the bus stop after the roundabout.
standing after the roundabout works also for hitching a ride north, as we found out. got a ride to Rovaniemi after a short wait.
Use the bus stop after the roundabout. First place to hitchhike after the highway.
Great spot to hitchhike Kuopio direction. Almost immediately got the ride even snow winter day
I went to the first bus stop in direction of Kuopio. Just 50m from car park. 15min wait.
Finns from JKL have recommanded us that spot too. It's really an excellent one, with plenty of space and trafic.
To Kuopio and Mikkeli. Very good point. You can take bus from centrum to get (only) near this spot.
Great visibility and nice bus stop, I had awesome ride with Latvian truck driver.
Good spot, drivers see you from far away. No cover from the rain though. We were 2 guys, waited 45 minutes here and got a ride to Inari.
Great spot to go north.
Perfect spot to continue north. Bus stop with slow speeds. First car stopped for me.
Great spot
For Helsinki / Turku. Traffic drives slow here. You an also try at the gas station.
We waited at the bus stop nearby because there was a construction, cars go slow, perfect for direction Jamsa.
Bus stop with a lot of space for cars to stop. Got a ride to Vääksy.
Really great spot, however wouldn't recommend taking shorter rides so wait for one that goes +100km

For a rather central Helsinki this is the only good spot for going outside, lots of cars with low speeds as they need to turn, nice area for cars to stop, always got a ride within 30 minutes, try to catch cars coming from ferries
Got a ride to Vaasa after just two minutes, really nice spot!
With sign "Turku". Got a ride to Turku, and was offered a place to sleep there aswell.

Great spot, a lot of Finns coming back from Sweden with snuff. Cars go cca 30kmh, plenty of time to decide if they wanna take you. Got a ride to Rovaniemi Santa Claus village in 30 minutes, dont forget to change your clock one hour forward once you arrive in Finland :)

! Have a sign ! 
Just after the border. Perfect spot for Rovaniemi / Oulu / North / etc. Slow speeds, plenty of traffic and tons of space for the cars to pull up.
Great spot for the Tampere direction. A lot of cars going from nearby gas station, a lot of space to stop and slow cars.

Not a bad spot for the ride south. However, I made a mistake and trusted my previous driver, who dropped me off here. I needed to go north, not south. But this guy brought me to a nice spot, where I could turn around.
Absolutely amazing spot, there is an even better one just after the roundabout though. Plenty of cars are going slowly in your direction.
Plenty of cars go to Porvoo. I hitched a boat to this place, and I had no trouble getting from here. You can be seen clearly, and there are plenty of locals and tourists going from the archipelago.
Good visibility for cars, got a ride quickly. (2 of us, northwards)
I was hitching with 2 friends, and we got Quick ride to neighbor city ivalo
Best spot outbound to Turku, plenty space to see you, plenty space to stop. Our wait was long due to hitchhiking at late evening.
Legal and safe spot to hitch out from Jyväskylä towards Tampere.
Got a ride to Kajaani from the second car that saw us. Great spot
Bus stop close to Soiva Metsä. Got a ride easily
Mid length walk from Mynämäki. Has a lot of forest close to camp in.
Good bus stop for going south. Got a ride to Tampere
Awesome spot to go north to Norway. Cars go pretty slow because it is in town and there’s a good amount of traffic.
Great spot for Ivalo direction.

When it was hard to get to here, the swedes in the villages are likely to stop by and ask where are u headed (even if they are going the different direction) -completely different vibe to few kilometers more south, seems like a nice small community around here, got stopped thrice within 20 minutes for getting a car towards Jeppo
Very nice bus stop and wide shoulder for going to the islands, decent amount of cars with very slow speeds, wait time of 5-10 minutes
Towards Rauma, nice wide area for cars to stop, speeds are slow, wait times of 5-20 minutes
Towards Tammisaari (Ekenäs), very nice view for cars coming on highway, long speeding lane, perfect spot with wait times of 5-15 minutes
Would recommend using a sign here, got a ride to Helsinki within 5-10 minutes, great spot relatively close to Lohja center

Towards Salo, this is the area where the national park ends and most cars take this road to go back to Salo or further, slower speeds and touristy area which makes easier for cars to pick you up. Wait time of 5-15 minutes
Perfect spot for going towards west direction, there's street lights for the darker times, wide and not that much used road so cars are likely to pick you up, got a car within 5 minutes
Bus stop towards north direction, slow speeds, very good spot, wait time of 5 minutes
Towards Vihti, traffic lights make the traffic slow, wide bus stop and lots of cars, wait time of 10-20 minutes

There is a bus stop.
Got a lift to Sodankyla just 10 mins after even though it was around 6pm at winter

There is a bus stop here.
Good spot.

Good spot. If you are heading down, there is a gas station across. If you are heading north, there is a bus stop. 
Got a lift to Kemijarvi by 3 minutes
Low traffic in winter, a few cars per hour I would say. I am lucky someone stopped at the gas station and could bring me to Vuotso.
Tried hitch hiking in winter. It worked. After waiting 30 minutes and about 10 cars passing me, someone brought me to Ivalo
The third car picked me up to drop me to Kemi
People going out of work. Find a guy to go north of Oulu. Lot of locals but worked for me
Middle of nowhere but there is a bus stop and find a ride to Jyvaskyla
With a sign, you can have car which enter the highway and the car on the highway
There is a bus stop and some traffic
Plenty of space for cars to stop. Grocery store and Alko nearby. Got a short ride to Kuusamo very quickly.
We were on the way north to Oulu. The first person we asked offered to take us 300km most of the way there to Kempele.
Got a ride to Espoo as soon as we lifted the sign and a thumb. Really good spot in our experience.
Low speed limit and very good visibility.

Bus stop with slow speeds. Perfect place to head south. Most cars will drive to at least Rovaniemi, as there isn't too many villages before that. Gas station next door and some decent woods to camp in 1km south of here.
Perfect spot here to head south. Really wide spot for cars to stop for you.
Bus stop. Clear view for the cars.
The road is under construction so the exact spot might change but now the speeds were very slow and I got a ride even before I started hitchhiking since my sign was visible. Going north.
Bus stop on the 8
Got a ride to Rauma in less than 5 minutes.  Lots of traffic and plenty of space to stop. The traffic is already sorted out so a really good spot if you want to go to Rauma or Turku
Nice Busstop, not alot of traffic, got picked up immediatly. Going south to Jyväskylä
Good flow of traffic, cars are going slow and have a good space to stop, theres a gasstation closeby :) Ride for 200km south.
Good spot but lower traffic in direction to Helsinki.
Good spot as there is a high traffic and also cars drive slowly because of speed radar after the bus stop.
Better spot than the gas station if you want to get more to the south in direction to the Jyvaskyla.
Very good spot to the South or Sweden, low traffic but lof of cars, caravans driving from holiday back to the south.
Good spot but very low traffic in the late evening. More trucks drove in there rather than cars.
Even in the late evening it's possible to get a ride to the south. People are friendly and helpful.
In the morning very low traffic but easy to get a ride to Ivalo.
Good spot to get to Kajaani.
Low traffic in the morning, but we got a ride at least nearby the main road to Kajaani.
Good spot but lower traffic in the evening, however we got a ride to Vuokatti. In the evening drove 3 cars in 30 minutes during summer.
It's better to hitchhike from the bus stop as less people drive to the gas station nearby.
Good spot to get a ride to the North.
Even we got a ride just for few kilometres, but we got out of the city.
Big gas station, lot of cars and trucks, but lot of cars were full or drove to their summer cottage. However it's possible to get a ride to Kuopio.
Lot of cars ride to the north, big chance to get a ride to Jyvaskyla.
Great spot with a lot of space to get a ride in direction to Mikkeli.
First car stopped and took us to Kannuskoski.Low traffic.
Not the worst spot, but very low traffic to get a ride in direction to Kouvola.
Great spot with a lot of space to Lappeenranta. High traffic.
Nice spot to hitchhike, good bus stop place for safe stopping, but could be more local cars then at the end of Hamina.

You should stay before trafficlight at the right side of road and ask drivers for ride to Himina or farther. 
I guess this is the only place where you can hitchhike.
Good for getting a ride to Helsinki. Cars get to see you when they stop at the traffic lights and there's plenty of space for them to pick you up.
Great spot to Kuopio from here even the direct eventually drive to Helsinki! This in January winter hitchhiking
Great spot to Joensuu after the ride from Kuopio to here. Didn't wait long even January winter

Great spot to Joensuu from here as only direct main road. Found direct to Riistavesi 
Winter January hitchhiking still good
Great spot to Helsinki from here and very lucky to get ride within 5 mins directly to Helsinki even January winter -10°c
Its not as bad spot as it is said to be. Cars have some space to stop and there are enough traffic but a sign can be useful.
A great one, a guy got me to Pihtipudas. Large bus station, cars going slowly and north. There is a gas station nearby if you need something.
Very good spot, a lot of cars stopping on this abc
Got a lucky ride to Lapland after an hour, good spot, large gas station to rest and charge if hitching is slow too.
Not so much traffics but find a ride straight to Oulu
Not great conditions, but trafic is low enough si people will stop. And it's not like there is any other options nearby. Got a ride to sweden in 5 min.
Very good spot towards Tornio, wait time of 5 minutes, seems like this junction can be used for any direction with a really good success rate
Some traffics and space to stop. Straight to Rovaniemi
Doesn't seem like popular spot for HH, but some crazy girl stopped, she asked me if I'm gonna kill her, and then took me to next ABC which was better spot.
Good spot
On the way north, waited with an Oulu sign. Got a short-ish ride to ABC Kirvaskangas relatively quickly. Not a perfect spot for cars to stop, but good enough. Walkable from the city center.
This place worked well. 5 minutes and got a cat.
I used a sign "short ride is enough" just to get past the highway part of the big road.
I would say one of the best spots on the way to Rovaniemi. Basically, all the cars going to Rovaniemi go on this road, and because it is rural, I believe they are much more willing to stop.
Great spot for Rovaniemi, this is the only road there pretty much, so someone will stop :)
Decent spot for catching a ride south
Best spot in Kuopio if you want to catch a ride to south.

Many cars, but mostly go to Kittila.
Great view and lots of space for cars
Perfect spot to head south. Many rides only might go to Kittilä, if so, try to get to the Neste gas station in the southern part of the town to get to good spot and minimize walking.
Not easy to get out of Helsinki but doable.
Yup, good spot. Ride to Lahti in 20mins. Sign highly recommended.

Got a lift til Lahti in 60mins, and several offers to get taken to the highway. 
I stood just _before_ the traffic lights, which was recommend to me by a local passing by. (maybe that's good because drivers don't accelerate yet, don't have to stop at the bus station (where indeed many busses stop), and still have enough time to pull over into the empty space next to the street (which at this point is still within in city limits so no need to worry about "stopping on the highway") idk.)
Agree with all of the comments above, only downside are the buses stopping here (like every 5 minutes), then cars cannot see you…
High traffic, but it was difficult to find someone who drives in direction to Porvoo because it's still nearby city center.
best spot to leave Tampere.
Bus stop. Long waiting time but eventually got a ride to Helsinki(Espoo). Put a sign that says Helsinki
Exquisite spot for going south, got a ride in 10 min
Good spot, but cars are driving fast and also there was a lot of buses so sometimes there wasn't space for car to stop.
I took me some time, but I still think is one good spot.
I managed to get really long ride from there. My rider was from Pudasjarvi, so I changed my route to Rovaniemi, it worked.
The Viitasaari ABC. Ask people for rides or have a sign. Works for both north and south.
great spot for direction Turku and Helsinki. i found a ride to Turku city centre. i reccomend using a sign
Got a ride to Turku in 30 minutes (07.2014).
Gas station, traffic going both directions. Have a sign.
Exquisite spot. Got a ride before I could finish eating my banana

Place was all good, lots of traffic. Side note: first time in Finland someone who said his nasty thoughts out loud gave me lift from this point. He gave his propose right before where promised to leave. I refused and he left me out safe.

Bus stop.
Towards Iisalmi and Kokkola.
Great spot
Kajaani Th L bus stop in direction Oulu. Quite a busy road. Got a (local) lift.

I was here already in dark, not the best visibility and got quite some middle fingers, however got a ride also within 20-30 minutes, so I'd say this is indeed a really good spot for going north, definitely the best on this road
Great bus stop for getting out of Vaasa and to continue north on the E8.
Indeed a very good spot for going towards Inkoo or Lohja, nice crossroad and wide bus stop (which is plowed well at winter too), wait time of 5-10 minutes

Good spot, with decent amount of traffic. Rather more likely to get a ride to Inkoo rather than all the way to the Capital Area. Our waiting time was probably affected by the number of us - 3 hitchhikers. (07.2014)
Direction Helsinki, alternative to the highway.
Space for car to stop and some traffics, you need to go up a small hill to arrive there but really good stop for Jyvaskyla
nice spot!

To JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤.

Take a buss from center and drop out at the stop of citymarket/prisma right after going over JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤-road. Then walk upperhill over the onramps. You can ask from driver or other passangers. After a road fence there is just enough space for cars to stop. It's not super good place, but gives me always a ride in half an hour.
Two girls, got a ride really fast to the Vaajakoski ABC with a sign "ABC". Good spot because of the traffic lights.

It is a bus stop and there are traffic lights before it so the cars are driving slowly and it is easy to see you. I have hitchhiked from this place to lahti and helsinki many times. You will probably catch a ride to Vaajakoski/ABC and there is a good place to continue.
To Kuopio, Mikkeli and Lahti. First you should take ride to the ABC in Vaajakoski. You can use sign "ABC" (people will understand). From ABC it's very easy to continue both (Lahti/Kuopio) directions.
Got a rode to Helsinki instantly :) Good flow of traffic alot of space for cars to stop, 24/7 open Gasstation with nice toilets closeby.
A bus stop just before the roundabout a good place to hitchhike to Lahti or Helsinki.
A great spot north. A lot of cars, a kinda spacious place to stop, everybody is going north.
got a ride to Viitasaari in 20 mins. standing on the bus stop works really well. slow traffic, drivers will be able to have a good look of you and your sign.
The Palokka ABC. A good spot for hitching north. Oulu, Rovaniemi etc. Stand on the bus stop before the highway ramp or ask people for a ride.
Great spot, slow speeds with a bus stop.
Easy ride to the north, especially to the Norway. We got ride to Karigasniemi.
We have tried to catch a car to Oulu Sunday noon. There was a few cars and enough place for them to stop.
I was unlucky and not so many cars going far on saturday but still probably the best spot here towards south.
Maybe I got lucky but I got a ride pretty quickly here. Seemed like the best spot in the area to head south. Just enough space for people to stop after the circle.
Spot is good, but not much traffic and got lucky that finally someone stopped. Summer/Sunday
Ok, but low traffic
Quite low traffic but otherwise a great spot to head south.
Good spot to the south, but very low traffic in the late evening.
Very good spot when heading north, I hitchhiked with the sign Jyväskylä
Waited with a Jyväskylä sign. A taxi driver took us to a different bus stop a little further out from where we soon got a ride to Jyväskylä.
A good spot with a lot of car and a bus station, we were 2 waiting with a "Jyväskylä" sign, no car stopped. It was monday at 8am so it might be the reason

Near university of applied sciences (TAMK). To Lahti and JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤. There is a good bus-stop where you can hitchhike ("Kissanmaa"). You can walk here from city center. You can take a car going to wrong city, but remember to jump out before motorways. Using sign isn't necessary. Wating times: 5-40min.
There is almost no traffic. I took 10min to see first car in this place, they stopped for me and took to Karigasniemi
Very few cars but otherwise a great spot. Also people are more prone to pick you up this middle of nowhere.

Nice environment. (2022) There is a beautiful river. There is not a single village towards Karasjok. So if you can, at least go to Karasjok! 
If you go into the forest you can eat wild blueberries. Forest soil is very interesting! It's shallow.There were a lot of mosquitoes. I didn't pay for accommodation, but I could take a shower in Inari for 5 euros!
Very good spot towards Karasjok, Norway, cars go very slow on the turn, so they can see you well, there is plenty of space to stop. Two guys we waited here for 20 minutes.
Walked there from Kamppi. In just under an hour we got a ride all the way to Tampere.

A lot of local traffic, but still the best bet for Tampere direction. If travelling light, even walkable (about 1h from downtown Helsinki), also blackriding the tram 10 is easy. If you get a short ride, be sure to get out at a petrol station (eg. Keimolanportti about 20 km away) rather than motorway junctions, which most are pretty quiet.
Waited 20 minutes to get a ride with people driving to Tampere
Maybe it was just bad day today, waited +1h with Hämeenlinna sign. But still the best spot to get out of Helsinki to Hämeenlinna and Tampere.
Wait a few meters before the bus stop, sign is a must. Really good place to hh.
Took some time, but found a ride all the way to Helsinki.
Good spot on the crossroad. Cars can go quite fast but there is good visibility, so with sign it is great.
Cars going a bit fast, but otherwise a good spot. Got a ride in 20 minutes
Cars are going pretty fast and doesn't seems to be used to hitchhikers
Good visibility and high traffic, kind of hard to get a ride.

As of March 2025 the spot seemed quite bad, little room for cars to stop, badly plowed bus stop, as well as wait time of 100 or so minutes before a local gave me a ride to " a better" spot, I'd honestly go with a bus a stop further and walk out of Ii for a ride north
Great stop but it was dark

Great spot to get more to the north. There is a high traffic and only one main road. Lot of cars from Sweden. We got a ride in less than 5 minutes all the way to Rovaniemi. Cars were driving slowly as there was a speed radar.

Early bird caught an enormous worm, got a ride not to Tornio or Haparanda but to GÄVLE 2 hours north of STOCKHOLM. Traffic lights just before this bus stop and a Shell gas station aswell. There is a bus from Oulu that stops at this bus station, highly recommend. A local suggested skipping Kemi and taking a ride all the way to Tornio, because many travel to Ikea Haparanda with an empty car and Kemi is nit very friendly for hitchhiking.
A bus stop with a lot of cars going to Kemi, and some trucks in the shell station
a man approached me and offered a ride straight to Tampere. i just got lucky because there was almost zero traffic on a Saturday afternoon.
Stood with Tampere sign, cars come slow out the station and rather good amount of traffic
Found ride from the person in petrol station to Hameenlinna. Definitely good spot to hitchhike even snow winter day
I've done this by showing the sign in the end of the petrol station
Petrol station complex Neste Keimolanportti itä situated in the suburb of Vantaa. You can easily arrive there from Helsinki by bus. The name of the bus station next to the petrol station is Keimola.
Decent spot, but not a great place for cars to stop. Got a ride surprisingly fast, though

Good spot to get a ride to Helsinki as there is high traffic, but not a lot of space for car to stop. However we didn't wait too long and one car wanted to stop but continues to drive and then came back for us in 10 minutes. So it's better to stay closer to the crossroad as cars have much more time to see you and then stop the car where there is still a space.
Towards Helsinki - the best spot, cars coming from 3 directions, they stop at the traffic lights and have enough time to think about picking you up.
Managed to get a ride to Hämeenlinna that goes through Tampere. A lot of cars.
We managed to get a ride from a taxi driver (!) on febuary in 30mn, but there's indeed not a lot of space. Decent spot but still looking for a better one.
Not allowed for pedestrians but a good place after traffic lights. Not a lot of space indeed but got a ride from a big truck in Lahti direction.
towars Keuruu and Turku:hitchhike after the traffic lights.
A good spot towards north and south (Bus stops). I think I was very unlucky here, but also not much traffic towards north. A gas station has quite limited opening times.
Bus station where there is good visibility, near to a gas station (toilets and so on)
It is ok, and there is a gas station across if you head north. Just low traffic, especially if you head south
headed to Tromso. not many cars around, but I just started to chat with one guy on gas station, and despite the fact he wasn´t heading there, he took us to Kilpisjarvi. We was very lucky.
Good for getting to Tampere. Got a ride within 15 minutes waiting at the exit.
The ABC petrol station about 5km northwest of the city. You should find a ride to Tampere relatively easy.
Good spot for heading towards Kemi, enough space for cars to see you and stop.
Kuolaniemi E bus stop. Scenic view over lake behind you, but is quite a long walk from Rovaniemi (~40m walk from bus stop near Lidl).
cars go really fast here, but short waiting time.
Got a ride to Helsinki after 15 Minutes while there was low traffic on a Sunday morning :)
Took us a while to get a ride to Helsinki, but we got one after being patient. Te traffic lights are a good place to position yourself. Cars can stop at the busstop after the crossing.

Technically this should be a good spot... But I stood there for 90 minutes without finding a ride and ended up taking a bus (23 line) to Ii, in the hopes of finding a ride from there. If your planning to go to Sweden from Oulu, I'd recommend going to Ii straight away (A-C zones). Don't waste your time.
Not a bad spot, you can be seen clearly. Low car traffic the further north you go, but people are more willing to take you in my opinion. There is a gas station nearby, but mostly local traffic.

Same story as my previous spot. There are only a few cars on this road, but they usually travel long distances. You can hide under a gas station roof in case of rain, as I did. In case you need a place to sleep, there is an emergency Laavu (shelter) nearby. There is a large place to stop, and you can be seen clearly.

The deeper you go into Lapland, the fewer cars there are. This is not the greatest spot, but I think you can't get much better. You can be seen clearly, and there is a place to stop. But most of the cars go left, not north.
Not much traffic

Pretty area. Not many people driving - you can wait hours between cars if you're unlucky. Might as well walk. But if a car passes, chances are it's a local, and chances are they'll pick you up out of curiosity. Keep an eye out for wolverines :)
Towards Oulu. Better to use the bus stop, asking people at the gas station might work as well. The driver could've taken us to Sievi, but we hopped off at Pihtipudas. (2 of us)
Spot is good, but there is almost no traffic, 1h is fine at this place.
Easily get to the next ABC
I was lucky to catch something to next station, but I would not say that this is a great spot.
Bus stop everywhere on this road. You can hytchike everywhere if there is good visibilty.

Eazy ride to Inari- Monday morning. 

On this road it's always easy. Just stand at any bustop.
Probably better Spot than Next to crossroad, but there is a High speed of cars
Not the best visibility, but a lot of cars going south
There is a finnish customs.  30 km/h and a traffic Light so cars go slowly.

Male, Sunday evening in summer, going south to Sweden. Mostly local traffic, but this is a place where people pass from Norway/Finland driving down to Sweden. Also a gasstation and a store nearby. Didn't need to camp because an elderly couple took me late in the evening to Sweden, but I think there is plenty of opportunities to camp in the forest.
A good spot towards Pori.
Towards south, bus stop with good visibility
Great spot for Oulu. Pretty much everyone from here go there.
Great spot for north. Pretty slow speeds after the roundabout and plenty of room to see you and stop.
A bit quiet but otherwise great.
Use one of the bus stops inside the village as cars have to drive slower.
At evening time there are lights, good visibility for cars and by now most locals have turned to sideroads, direction Oulu, wait times of 20-30 minutes
Northbound direction, seems like a very poor bus stop to hitchhike, however I got a ride within 5 minutes, probably 20-30 minutes seems more likely
Towards north, good visibility, decent speeds, okay bus stop, wait times of 20-30 minutes
Pretty good bus stop towards Hanko, nice spot for cars to stop, also helped by the traffic light which keeps the speeds down, wait time of 20-30 minutes

Wait time of 20-40 minutes, not too many cars are using this entrance for Inkoo direction, but it's a really nice spot accessable with trains from Helsinki (to Masala or Jorvas depending on which line you take and walk here-- on side note, be careful of ticket inspections and don't take lines further than Kirkkonummi.

Probably not the best way, but alternative route taken by trailers, slow trucks etc to go towards north to Hämeenlinna, very nice for cars to stop, especially for the ones coming from Hyvinkää, wait time of 10-30 minutes

Not that commonly used road but people are likely to pick you up, most cars go at least to Nurmijärvi, during wintertime the road was quite snowy (the bus stop area wasn't plowed through) but the road itself is wide, wait time of 10-30 minutes
Pretty decent bus stop towards Vihti, lots of cars, speeds are not that fast cuz of the roundabout earlier, got a car within couple minutes, but would expect 10-20 minutes wait time otherwise

There is a bus stop here. If you head toward Levi or Kittila, this spot is better than just in front of Muonio, since there is basically no space for car to stop there.
There are lots of space here thanks to the bus stop.
Low traffic but car goes at 50kmh so you have time to show your sign
Really low traffic but find a car to Aura
Had to walk 30 minutes and then there are space to stop and some traffics to go to Helsinki
Not a lot of traffic but space to stop and gas station near by

Waited with "Kouvola" sign. About a fifth of the cars seemed to take the highway to the west (Kouvola/Mikkeli direction).
Cars can stop at the bus stop and possibly by the ramp onto the highway. Got a ride to Porvoo (through Kouvola) eventually.
Nice view from the road. I got dropped off at the ABC nearby so I had to walk a bit. Used both thumb and a sign saying "Hki" (short for Helsinki)
Room for cars to pull over is a little tight. However, there is a lot of traffic and we got a ride fairly quickly.

The cars go quite fast but they can see you from far away and there is plenty of room to pull over at the bus stop. We waited with a "Joensuu" sign and were later told that most of the people driving south here are going there. Comes down to peoples attitude towards hitchhikers.
Waited with "Kajaani" sign. The cars go quite fast but the drivers can see you from far away and they can pull over at the bus stop.
Waited with "Kemijärvi" sign in the morning. Most people seemed to just drive short distances. Cars go pretty slow though and we quickly got a ride to Ruka near Kuusamo.
Good spot to go to Turku. People here seem to be very friendly and stop easily.
Because of the speed bumps, cars have to go very slowly, and there is only one direction to go on the big street.
Waited in the doorway because of the rain and asked around. Relaxed people, lot of going to different directions. Got a ride to Kerava.
headed to Tromso. I think it´s good spot, also cars can stop, and many Norwegian people go to kilpis to buy cheap stuff. bigger problem is to get to Kilpisjarvi, than from there more northern.
near bus stop. roads quite empty. got a ride to muonio after 2 hours of waiting

The spot is a little outside of Vaasa, but you can reach it with a bus. I waited 20 minutes until a truck gave me a ride to pori, but it was early noon in a workday, so I think it will be faster at other times. The spot is right after a traffic light and the cars can see you from a distance, there is plenty of space even for a truck to stop for you
There wasnt alot of traffic and the cars are going quite fast, got a ride to Ivalo with a taxi, not really anything around ^^'

Bus stop next to the highway, there is also a gas station here. Speed limit increases from 60 to 100 km/h immediately after the bus stop, so choosing one or two bus stops earlier might be nicer for the cars to be slower (speed limit is 60 all throughout Kuivaniemi and there is a camera at one of the bus stops so cars actually go slowly) . But there is plenty of space to pull over, I got super lucky and after about 30 minutes a truck stopped for me and took me to Oulu. (Female, summer, daytime)
It could be better....(2022)
Here or at the second nearest gas station, direction Jamsa
Low traffic, cars drove to nearest villages so not that far away more to the Oulu.
As there is a low traffic you have to wait for someone to stop, there is a high chance to have first car to stop.
Not the best stop, but we got ride to the north.

Quiet big gas station with enough traffic, so you can get ride to all directions. 
I had a sign "Kotka" with me and caught car directly to.

Not really perfect spot, but cars going slowly there and it's possible to catch someone. 
At morning time drivers have not good review of you because of the sunshine.
Not much space for car to stop but even so I got ride to the nearest rest spot along the highway
Decent spot but doesn't seem to have too many cars heading north. Slow speeds though and has a service station next door.
Not too much room for cars to stop but a high amount of traffic. Got a ride here within 5 minutes
I don´t think you can get much better when going towards Kittilä. I hitchhiked just behind the crossroads, only to realise there is a better spot not far away.
Roadside, not a lot of space for cars to stop. We got a ride to Kolari in 15 min., but maybe we were too lucky...
Got a ride just 10 km down the road to a pretty good spot
Slower speeds but not too much space for the cars to stop. Still works fine. Got a long ride to Heinola after the car passed once and came back for me.
Cars drive slowly, easy to get a ride in direction to Jyvaskyla. However in the late evening we got someone who took us just few kilometres, so not a long distance.
One female, waited 10 minutes, only using thumb. About one car per minute.
A bus stop. 2 of us waited for about 1,5 hours in total to get a lift to Rovaniemi.
High traffic but lot of cars drove to nearby village or in direction to Helsinki, however we got a ride to Hamina.

Tried to get a ride towards Lappenranta direction from 12.30 pm to 5 pm on Tuesday. A lot of truck drivers to ask. But farest that people were driving to was Porvoo. Most of them were going to Helsinki. Got stuck here and had to return back to Helsinki.
To all directions. A petrol station. Asking people for rides works pretty well here.
Succeeded to get a right straight to Kokkola.  Traffic lights and turn before crossroads helps.
To Ylöjärvi, Parkano and Vaasa. You can get here by bus number 3. Cars stop at the traffic lights (and have enough time to think about picking you up) but they also drive rather fast so use a sign.
Nowadays you should directly ask that little cars which are going to border control.
Good spot for asking drivers directly. Raja Market.
Easy even without a lot of traffics
A safe spot to hitchhike on the bus stop on the ramp, plenty space to stop and the cars are moving slow. Used both sign and a thumb.

I am very surprised of the previous comments. The spot is safe as there is a beautiful bustop to pull over. It was cosy to wait there, I was on the onramp of the highway, I had a sign and an Electric vehicle took me.
I just take ride after 20 minutes, but I really know that I had a lot of fortune there.

Ppl were so shocked that they started to make pictures with me and they forgot what I was asking... This was on petrol station, near it is bus stop... nothing better just stupid behaviour, after 10 hours I started to say please to every car and one stopped...
WRONG SPOT ! the spot people talk about here is on the other side of the road.
Great spot if you go to south. Literally got a ride just after arrived
Best spot to go south of Rovaniemi

Best spot to catch all the traffic from Rovaniemi to the South. There's space to stop the car on the side of the road even though there is no bus stop. Cars are driving by slowly because there is a traffic light just before. An okay walking distance from the centre.
Good spot towards the north
Decent if you can get someone to drive you there, you might get a ride faster than me if you're not going all the way to Vaasa

Relatively silent gas station but got a ride with a sign and a thumb (Saying Helsinki on one side, Salo on the other one) after 10 minutes to Salo. The driver who took me to the gas station recommended to try to get to Salo for a straight ride to Helsinki.

If you end up near paimo like me (the first lift couldn't take me further) this Petrol station is quite a good spot to get further. There was not a lot of traffic when I was there, but it's near the highway and a lot of the cars are going to Helsinki. You just have to ask the drivers directly, I think just standing there with a sign would take quite long since it's not a very bis petrol station. I got lucky and the first person I asked took me to Helsinki :)
I General not the best spot, but if
This is a university parking lot... The vast majority of cars will be local to Joensuu and surrounding villages. But if you don't care too much where your going, then sure..
towards Kuopio, Varkaus, Helsinki.
Used this bus stop for about 50 minutes before walking further up the road, not that good of a spot, speeds are high and at winter the conditions were very poor in the bus stop
Bus stop to Oulu direction.

Towards Jyväskylä. Quite busy morning traffic, but most of the cars and virtually all the cars on the closer lane were heading to Helsinki. Important to have a clear sign visible to the cars on the further lane coming from ABC.

Probably a great spot if you want to go to helsinki (two cars stopped within one hour and offered to take me there, and many slowed down to read my sign that said "Jyväskylä" and shook their heads). 
no one stopped for jyväskylä, but the bus stop in the other direction is convenient for getting to stop'n go grill (see there for further comments).
If you hitchhike here, a sign is necessary. I tried for about 15 minutes, but preferred going to the highway entrance.
A bus stop, both the cars from the ABC petrolstation and from Lahti go through here. And the cars can you see you at the lights...
